result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kaleb Leitzinger

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 16, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Scheduling conference on September 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:20 PM - case called.  Defendant Kaleb Leitzinger appeared by video, in custody from MJTC.  Attorney Cana G Kohn in court for Kaleb Leitzinger.  Attorney Kristopher R Ellis in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Kohn regarding Defendant's request to appear in person; issues with transport.  Response by Atty Ellis.  Statement by the Court - will proceed with this matter.  Sgt. Investigator Kevin Orzech duly sworn and testifies.  Direct by Atty Ellis.  Defendant identified by Sgt. Investigator Orzech.  No cross by Atty Kohn.  Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings.  Information filed with the Court.  In receipt - waive reading - plea of not guilty.  Court accepts not guilty plea.  Bond will continue.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:42 PM - case called.  Defendant Kaleb Leitzinger appeared by video, in custody from Mendota.  Attorney Cana G Kohn in court for Kaleb Leitzinger.  Attorney Andrew Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim rights.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Statement by Atty Kohn - in receipt of complaint - waive reading.  Bond has already been set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No violent or abusive contact with the victim if the Defendant is housed at Lincoln Hills School.  No contact with the victim if not housed at Lincoln Hills School.
Bail faxed to Mendota for Defendant to sign and return.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No violent or abusive contact with the victim if the Defendant is housed at Lincoln Hills School.  No contact with the victim if not housed at Lincoln Hills School.

1:43 PM - case called.   Defendant Kaleb Leitzinger appeared by video, in custody from Mendota.  Attorney Andrew Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim rights.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  In receipt of complaint - charge read to Defendant - right to counsel.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court sets bond.  Court will adjourn this matter to allow the Defendant time to retain an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
